body:
They're not supposed to intervene. It's not right at all imo. Ever since xigbar and darkforge and others were banned.

The admins aren't perfect. They're a little ban happy for me. I just wish they set standards for dealing with any TOS violations. A user I knew got instantly suspended for 24hrs because his bio had a satirical #KillTrump which was mimicking edgy leftist twitter bios. 

In some situations they banned users permanently on the first TOS violation and in some cases they issued 24h suspensions. I hope in the future that the admins make sure to apply the TOS fairly to all users and eventually reverse all of these bans. I don't think that'll happen however.

I'd much prefer if they handed out account warnings instead of immediately handing out bans.

post.title: This made me kekkle my shekels lol

body:
> They're not supposed to intervene. It's not right at all imo. Ever since xigbar and darkforge and others were banned.

I was predicting this from the beginning because I smelled fraud on the whole "free of censorship" platform they advertised. I had a lot of enemies that hated me, suddenly take sides with a Nazi because of censorship and abuse of power. DarkForge had me blocked, but when I got banned, my guilds stolen and given to the admin's discord (and openly communist cabal) it united both sides because they knew it was wrong. In my absence they formed alliances and rose against the dishonest actions of the admins. 

They reversed my guild seizing only when it was exposed that their cabal broke the same rules without scrutiny, and temp banned just one member to "give us the crumb to make us forget about the rest of the cookie" so to speak, but it didn't work. People like CrystalVulpine, DarkForge and others began a truth campaign exposing the admins lies and totally blatant bias, which they couldn't deny. 

> The admins aren't perfect. They're a little ban happy for me. I just wish they set standards for dealing with any TOS violations. A user I knew got instantly suspended for 24hrs because his bio had a satirical #KillTrump which was mimicking edgy leftist twitter bios.

They surpassed reddit in 6 months in censorship and hostile acts against their own userbase, all the while claiming to be the anti-reddit. 

> In some situations they banned users permanently on the first TOS violation and in some cases they issued 24h suspensions. I hope in the future that the admins make sure to apply the TOS fairly to all users and eventually reverse all of these bans. I don't think that'll happen however.

That isn't going to happen. They were never free speech. It was a ploy to gain a userbase to support their site, only to pull a bait-and-switch once it gained momentum. I was the litmus test for that free speech. If you remember klenvestargan (sp?) he was banned for a rule that didn't even exist in the ToS yet. 

> I'd much prefer if they handed out account warnings instead of immediately handing out bans.

That's under the premise you have fair and honest admins. (You don't).
body_html:
They're not supposed to intervene. It's not right at all imo. Ever since xigbar and darkforge and others were banned.

I was predicting this from the beginning because I smelled fraud on the whole "free of censorship" platform they advertised. I had a lot of enemies that hated me, suddenly take sides with a Nazi because of censorship and abuse of power. DarkForge had me blocked, but when I got banned, my guilds stolen and given to the admin's discord (and openly communist cabal) it united both sides because they knew it was wrong. In my absence they formed alliances and rose against the dishonest actions of the admins.

They reversed my guild seizing only when it was exposed that their cabal broke the same rules without scrutiny, and temp banned just one member to "give us the crumb to make us forget about the rest of the cookie" so to speak, but it didn't work. People like CrystalVulpine, DarkForge and others began a truth campaign exposing the admins lies and totally blatant bias, which they couldn't deny.

The admins aren't perfect. They're a little ban happy for me. I just wish they set standards for dealing with any TOS violations. A user I knew got instantly suspended for 24hrs because his bio had a satirical #KillTrump which was mimicking edgy leftist twitter bios.

They surpassed reddit in 6 months in censorship and hostile acts against their own userbase, all the while claiming to be the anti-reddit.

In some situations they banned users permanently on the first TOS violation and in some cases they issued 24h suspensions. I hope in the future that the admins make sure to apply the TOS fairly to all users and eventually reverse all of these bans. I don't think that'll happen however.

That isn't going to happen. They were never free speech. It was a ploy to gain a userbase to support their site, only to pull a bait-and-switch once it gained momentum. I was the litmus test for that free speech. If you remember klenvestargan (sp?) he was banned for a rule that didn't even exist in the ToS yet.

I'd much prefer if they handed out account warnings instead of immediately handing out bans.

That's under the premise you have fair and honest admins. (You don't).

In some situations they banned users permanently on the first TOS violation and in some cases they issued 24h suspensions. I hope in the future that the admins make sure to apply the TOS fairly to all users and eventually reverse all of these bans. I don't think that'll happen however.

I'd much prefer if they handed out account warnings instead of immediately handing out bans.

post.title: This made me kekkle my shekels lol

body:
>I was predicting this from the beginning because I smelled fraud on the whole "free of censorship" platform they advertised. I had a lot of enemies that hated me, suddenly take sides with a Nazi because of censorship and abuse of power. DarkForge had me blocked, but when I got banned, my guilds stolen and given to the admin's discord (and openly communist cabal) it united both sides because they knew it was wrong. In my absence they formed alliances and rose against the dishonest actions of the admins.

For the record, I participated in the RCP. We decided to bait people into thinking that Ruqqus has been infiltrated by AHS/CCP shills. The first original post by Emerald(Sion) was supposed to be very obvious bait but it managed to fool a lot of people. 

It caused a reaction and it was spicy drama so Emerald made another follow up post for it and hilarity ensued. Over time the trolling effort has increased. Which made even the skeptics start to think there was something going on. Coupled with amazingly coincidental Admin decisions made it look like Admins were cooperating with us.

Even Captain took the bait at first but was made aware by Kek who saw it for what it is from a mile away. You might've seen screenshots of Kek joining the RCP Discord which made the conspiracy that the site is compromised look even more true, but no. Kek came to observe what we were doing, and even went on to clarify the situation after Sion321(Emerald's alt) got themselves temp-banned by spamming in order to look like they were censored by Admins.

I understand why you think there is a cabal, but I assure you there's nothing. It's all a larp. Also, the mod who leaked the info that you were banned was de-modded for it. It was a mistake by Admins and carp and others took advantage of that to further escalate the drama.

I think Xigbar and Extract took this way too seriously, which unfortunately for them, not what they thought it actually was at all. I tried to reach out to Xigbar a couple of times to explain to him because I thought he got too worked up by it, but he refused and thought I was trolling him. He also thought I was admitting to vote-brigading him once on Discord..? (I'm not sure how he reached that conclusion)

I don't believe in shills, at least not on this platform yet. Just dedicated trolls. That's what +DeuxRAMA is all about. I larp as SJW far-leftist sometimes because that's what some people assume I am, not knowing I run a lot of guilds that harbor free-speech. It's also nice to have fun occasionally. 

I can talk about this in more detail if you want, I'm just giving a summary of my perspective. The RCP has been dead for some time now. 

>That isn't going to happen. They were never free speech. It was a ploy to gain a userbase to support their site, only to pull a bait-and-switch once it gained momentum. I was the litmus test for that free speech. If you remember klenvestargan (sp?) he was banned for a rule that didn't even exist in the ToS yet.

I actually thought this was a blunder on the Admins part. He didn't deserve to be banned, and certainly didn't deserve his privacy be exposed. I was surprised Admins didn't clearly define using alts to mod more guilds in the TOS. I was pissed too because I thought it was bullshit. Even when I didn't like Klen all that much, I was starting to be a little weary ever since that happened because of how horribly it was handled. 

>They reversed my guild seizing only when it was exposed that their cabal broke the same rules without scrutiny, and temp banned just one member to "give us the crumb to make us forget about the rest of the cookie" so to speak, but it didn't work. People like CrystalVulpine, DarkForge and others began a truth campaign exposing the admins lies and totally blatant bias, which they couldn't deny.

Emerald was banned accordingly to the TOS. (All alts perm banned and the main temp banned for 7 days). She also left RCP and Ruqqus afterwards. DarkForge made frequent posts in +DeuxRAMA about carp and the drama which I thought were hilarious. I was upset when he was banned, I also talked to him before and I thought he was chill. I want this "Harassment" policy to be clearly defined or be removed entirely because it honestly serves no purpose. 

>That's under the premise you have fair and honest admins. (You don't).

Jason was the first to write about his experience with captain before. I ignored the warnings at first but I'm starting to think he may be right after all.
body_html:
I was predicting this from the beginning because I smelled fraud on the whole "free of censorship" platform they advertised. I had a lot of enemies that hated me, suddenly take sides with a Nazi because of censorship and abuse of power. DarkForge had me blocked, but when I got banned, my guilds stolen and given to the admin's discord (and openly communist cabal) it united both sides because they knew it was wrong. In my absence they formed alliances and rose against the dishonest actions of the admins.

For the record, I participated in the RCP. We decided to bait people into thinking that Ruqqus has been infiltrated by AHS/CCP shills. The first original post by Emerald(Sion) was supposed to be very obvious bait but it managed to fool a lot of people.

It caused a reaction and it was spicy drama so Emerald made another follow up post for it and hilarity ensued. Over time the trolling effort has increased. Which made even the skeptics start to think there was something going on. Coupled with amazingly coincidental Admin decisions made it look like Admins were cooperating with us.

Even Captain took the bait at first but was made aware by Kek who saw it for what it is from a mile away. You might've seen screenshots of Kek joining the RCP Discord which made the conspiracy that the site is compromised look even more true, but no. Kek came to observe what we were doing, and even went on to clarify the situation after Sion321(Emerald's alt) got themselves temp-banned by spamming in order to look like they were censored by Admins.

I understand why you think there is a cabal, but I assure you there's nothing. It's all a larp. Also, the mod who leaked the info that you were banned was de-modded for it. It was a mistake by Admins and carp and others took advantage of that to further escalate the drama.

I think Xigbar and Extract took this way too seriously, which unfortunately for them, not what they thought it actually was at all. I tried to reach out to Xigbar a couple of times to explain to him because I thought he got too worked up by it, but he refused and thought I was trolling him. He also thought I was admitting to vote-brigading him once on Discord..? (I'm not sure how he reached that conclusion)

I don't believe in shills, at least not on this platform yet. Just dedicated trolls. That's what +DeuxRAMA is all about. I larp as SJW far-leftist sometimes because that's what some people assume I am, not knowing I run a lot of guilds that harbor free-speech. It's also nice to have fun occasionally.

I can talk about this in more detail if you want, I'm just giving a summary of my perspective. The RCP has been dead for some time now.

That isn't going to happen. They were never free speech. It was a ploy to gain a userbase to support their site, only to pull a bait-and-switch once it gained momentum. I was the litmus test for that free speech. If you remember klenvestargan (sp?) he was banned for a rule that didn't even exist in the ToS yet.

I actually thought this was a blunder on the Admins part. He didn't deserve to be banned, and certainly didn't deserve his privacy be exposed. I was surprised Admins didn't clearly define using alts to mod more guilds in the TOS. I was pissed too because I thought it was bullshit. Even when I didn't like Klen all that much, I was starting to be a little weary ever since that happened because of how horribly it was handled.

They reversed my guild seizing only when it was exposed that their cabal broke the same rules without scrutiny, and temp banned just one member to "give us the crumb to make us forget about the rest of the cookie" so to speak, but it didn't work. People like CrystalVulpine, DarkForge and others began a truth campaign exposing the admins lies and totally blatant bias, which they couldn't deny.

Emerald was banned accordingly to the TOS. (All alts perm banned and the main temp banned for 7 days). She also left RCP and Ruqqus afterwards. DarkForge made frequent posts in +DeuxRAMA about carp and the drama which I thought were hilarious. I was upset when he was banned, I also talked to him before and I thought he was chill. I want this "Harassment" policy to be clearly defined or be removed entirely because it honestly serves no purpose.

That's under the premise you have fair and honest admins. (You don't).

Jason was the first to write about his experience with captain before. I ignored the warnings at first but I'm starting to think he may be right after all.

parent.body:
> They're not supposed to intervene. It's not right at all imo. Ever since xigbar and darkforge and others were banned.

I was predicting this from the beginning because I smelled fraud on the whole "free of censorship" platform they advertised. I had a lot of enemies that hated me, suddenly take sides with a Nazi because of censorship and abuse of power. DarkForge had me blocked, but when I got banned, my guilds stolen and given to the admin's discord (and openly communist cabal) it united both sides because they knew it was wrong. In my absence they formed alliances and rose against the dishonest actions of the admins. 

They reversed my guild seizing only when it was exposed that their cabal broke the same rules without scrutiny, and temp banned just one member to "give us the crumb to make us forget about the rest of the cookie" so to speak, but it didn't work. People like CrystalVulpine, DarkForge and others began a truth campaign exposing the admins lies and totally blatant bias, which they couldn't deny. 

> The admins aren't perfect. They're a little ban happy for me. I just wish they set standards for dealing with any TOS violations. A user I knew got instantly suspended for 24hrs because his bio had a satirical #KillTrump which was mimicking edgy leftist twitter bios.

They surpassed reddit in 6 months in censorship and hostile acts against their own userbase, all the while claiming to be the anti-reddit. 

> In some situations they banned users permanently on the first TOS violation and in some cases they issued 24h suspensions. I hope in the future that the admins make sure to apply the TOS fairly to all users and eventually reverse all of these bans. I don't think that'll happen however.

That isn't going to happen. They were never free speech. It was a ploy to gain a userbase to support their site, only to pull a bait-and-switch once it gained momentum. I was the litmus test for that free speech. If you remember klenvestargan (sp?) he was banned for a rule that didn't even exist in the ToS yet. 

> I'd much prefer if they handed out account warnings instead of immediately handing out bans.

That's under the premise you have fair and honest admins. (You don't).
parent.body_html:
They're not supposed to intervene. It's not right at all imo. Ever since xigbar and darkforge and others were banned.

I was predicting this from the beginning because I smelled fraud on the whole "free of censorship" platform they advertised. I had a lot of enemies that hated me, suddenly take sides with a Nazi because of censorship and abuse of power. DarkForge had me blocked, but when I got banned, my guilds stolen and given to the admin's discord (and openly communist cabal) it united both sides because they knew it was wrong. In my absence they formed alliances and rose against the dishonest actions of the admins.

They reversed my guild seizing only when it was exposed that their cabal broke the same rules without scrutiny, and temp banned just one member to "give us the crumb to make us forget about the rest of the cookie" so to speak, but it didn't work. People like CrystalVulpine, DarkForge and others began a truth campaign exposing the admins lies and totally blatant bias, which they couldn't deny.

The admins aren't perfect. They're a little ban happy for me. I just wish they set standards for dealing with any TOS violations. A user I knew got instantly suspended for 24hrs because his bio had a satirical #KillTrump which was mimicking edgy leftist twitter bios.

They surpassed reddit in 6 months in censorship and hostile acts against their own userbase, all the while claiming to be the anti-reddit.

In some situations they banned users permanently on the first TOS violation and in some cases they issued 24h suspensions. I hope in the future that the admins make sure to apply the TOS fairly to all users and eventually reverse all of these bans. I don't think that'll happen however.

That isn't going to happen. They were never free speech. It was a ploy to gain a userbase to support their site, only to pull a bait-and-switch once it gained momentum. I was the litmus test for that free speech. If you remember klenvestargan (sp?) he was banned for a rule that didn't even exist in the ToS yet.

I'd much prefer if they handed out account warnings instead of immediately handing out bans.

That's under the premise you have fair and honest admins. (You don't).

body:
> I understand why you think there is a cabal, but I assure you there's nothing. It's all a larp. Also, the mod who leaked the info that you were banned was de-modded for it. It was a mistake by Admins and carp and others took advantage of that to further escalate the drama.

All I had to see was carpfag crying to his boyfriend capt and results were instant. Everything the cabal (and it IS a cabal, there's no denying it) ever wanted they got. People were getting banned left and right for spam, harassment, alt abuse, yet carpfag and company ran a muck doing the same shit with no consequence. That's why they're so ban happy, admins are in bed with their discord fags and have to protect them. It's amazing how defiant they are to the mass of users on here, almost like this site was never supposed to be successful or remain true to its advertised platform.
